body.p:
Greenville Ky June 18th 1861.
P Swigert Sec'y M B
Dear Sir

I notice that blank forms are being printed for use of State & Home Guards. We have formed Several companies of Home Guards in this county & want arms. Will you be kind enough to foward me the blanks. I have been elected Captain of Muhlenberg Home Guards No 1 and have about 90 men in my company. We have taken the oath required by law, & will leave certificate of Presiding Judge of county. All of which will be forwarded in a few days. Would be pleased to receive some instruction from you, as to mode of application &c.

Yours Respectfully
Edwd R Weir Sr.

P S
We will give a good Majority for Union candidate for Congress (Capt Jackson) though desperate efforts are being made to take our Union men off. I regard Jackson's election certain by a majority of two or three thousand.

Muhlenberg County 1861
E. R. Weir
Home Guard
Muhlenberg Co
Recd yours 28 June 1861.
Granted
